Lore: I forgot to mention this in the post, but this pyramid structure is supposed to provide some lore to the Deep Dark. More specifically, it is supposed to suggest that there was an ancient civilization, long ago, that built this structure to honor the Warden, which they saw as an ancient and powerful deity. They made the pyramid of the unnamed stone that makes up the Deep Dark to replicate the habitat of the Warden. They also made the stone Warden statue to protect their treasure, while also showing they made the statue to worship the Warden.

I am thinking have the starting value be somewhere between 3-5. If the starting value is 3, then it would be able to multiply into 8 buds. If it starts at 4, then it would multiply into 16. If it starts at 5 it would multiply into 32. 5 is starting to get pretty overpowered, so those would be rare.

Another idea is that Budding Amethyst blocks can be moved but if they are placed anywhere other than the Geode then they just turn into normal Amethyst Blocks. This could also allow people to fill one geode with more Budding Amethyst than there originally was

Or, Amethyst Blocks naturally turn into Budding Amethyst if they are within a Geode Structure and there isn't a certain amount of Budding Amethyst already there. Amethyst Crystals could even turn into Amethyst Blocks, allowing the Geode to be self-regenerating, a feature I think Stalactites should also do.
I think Glow Squids should drop Glow Dye that gives any dyable thing a glow texture, which includes glass

Instead of adding 2 new specialized items just for this single use case, why not just add this feature to the existing leather boots? And maybe make the boots not entirely silent, but just significantly quieter, so you still have to be careful have fast you move, but you won't trigger the sculk sensor or warden until you're closer than usual.

Also, I'm not sure I understand what the "warmth" thing is about. What would "warmth" even do, and why?

I like it, but... I would make them bunny slippers.  They should not provide an antidote to freezing, but instead make it harder for skulk sensors and Wardens to hear you.  Plus, they would look adorable and come in all the different colors of wool.  They should not provide any armor and have very low durability.

I had a similar idea. I was thinking that maybe as they lose durability, they become less effective since they have "holes" in them and your feet are touching the ground, and they can be repaired with either wool or string. The lower the durability, the less effective they are and the less noise they block out. I also had the idea of them blocking noise to skulk blocks. Maybe they aren't as effective as wool since they are not as thin and don't block out noise when you fall from a certain height or run. Also, it would be good if they can't be enchanted.
FINALLY a non-cosmetic use for leather armor

A) The Sonic Boom does not insta-kill and can be reduced by the Resistance effect. If it‚Äôs still too much, the damage of the sonic boom can be reduced by the difficulty. Another thing, the Deep Dark and Ancient Cities are designed to be something you have to go out of your way to find. B) Chat reporting only works for saying bad stuff in chat, and is meant to protect players from malicious content. Be a good person and participate on good servers, and you have nothing to worry about.
